data.title: Who has won the most Frozen Fours? List of past winners of NCAA men's hockey championship
data.meta_description: Four of the winningest programs in NCAA ice hockey history are meeting in St. Paul this weekend to determine the 2024 national champion.
data.text:
At the 2023 Frozen Four, Quinnipiac earned its first-ever national championship when Jacob Quillan lifted the Bobcats to an overtime win over Minnesota.

That wasn't the case in 2024, as Denver climbed back to the mountaintop and captured its second title in the last three years alone.

The Frozen Four featured some of the most storied programs in the history of college hockey, with all four possessing at least five national championships and representing some of the most hockey-crazed regions of the country.

Denver and Boston College advanced to the championship game in a battle of two ultra recognizable programs, but the Eagles' bevy of NHL talent wasn't enough to prevent a shutout at the hands of the Pioneers.

Here is a look at the past champions of the NCAA Frozen Four and who has won the most titles in college hockey after Denver's win.

MORE: Frozen Four 2024 schedule, bracket, results

Who has won the most NCAA Frozen Fours?

Michigan and Denver are tied for the most NCAA Division I men's college hockey championships. Both have nine, with Denver last winning in 2022. Michigan has not won since 1998.

North Dakota is in second with eight. Wisconsin has six, and Boston College, Boston University, and Minnesota each have five.

Here's a look at all the past winners and how many times each program has won.

Team Championships Years Won Denver 10 1958, 1960, 1961, 1968, 1969, 2004, 2005, 2017, 2022, 2024 Michigan 9 1948, 1951, 1952, 1953, 1955, 1956, 1964, 1996, 1998 North Dakota 8 1959, 1963, 1980, 1982, 1987, 1997, 2000, 2016 Wisconsin 6 1973, 1977, 1981, 1983, 1990, 2006 Boston College 5 1949, 2001, 2008, 2010, 2012 Boston University 5 1971, 1972, 1978, 1995, 2009 Minnesota 5 1974, 1976, 1979, 2002, 2003 Lake Superior State 3 1988, 1992, 1994 Michigan State 3 1966, 1986, 2007 Michigan Tech 3 1962, 1965, 1975 Minnesota Duluth 3 2011, 2018, 2019 Colorado College 2 1950, 1957 Cornell 2 1967, 1970 Maine 2 1993, 1999 RPI 2 1954, 1985 Bowling Green 1 1984 Harvard 1 1989 UMass 1 2021 Northern Michigan 1 1991 Providence 1 2015 Union 1 2014 Yale 1 2013 Quinnipiac 1 2023

List of every NCAA Frozen Four champion

Last year, Quinnipiac joined a number of programs that earned their first NCAA title over the past decade.

Since 2010, UMass, Union, Yale, Providence, Minnesota-Duluth, and Quinnipiac all earned their program's first national titles. Minnesota-Duluth won its first in 2011, then went back-to-back in 2018 and 2019 to push the school's total to three.

Here are all the Frozen Four tournament winners:
